intro: Gratiola floridana, commonly known as Florida yellowroot, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, oval fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its roots are yellowish in color and have been historically used in traditional medicine. Gratiola floridana thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
